required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: The Development of an Artificial Intelligence Platform for Screening and Referral of Cognitive Dysfunction

brief_summary.textblock: There is association between eye movement disorder and cognitive dysfunction. Therefore, utilizing eye movement and screening for cognitive dysfunction is feasible. In the present study, we will develop an artificial intelligence platform to screening for cognitive dysfunction by inspecting the function of eye movement. Futher more, based on the screening results, the platform will offer referral suggestions.

primary_outcome.description: AUC values for predicting whether subject has cognitive impairment or not

secondary_outcome.measure: Accuracy, true positive rate, and true negetive rate
secondary_outcome.description: The performance of this artificial platform

arm_group.description: Subjects over 45 years old without cognitive dysfunction
Subjects who are diagnosed as mild cognitive decline(MCI) according to neurologists.
Subjects who are diagnosed as Alzheimer's disease(AD) according to neurologists.
Subjects who are diagnosed as vascular dementia(VD) according to neurologists.
Subjects who are diagnosed as Lewy body demenita (DLB) according to neurologists.
Subjects who are diagnosed as Frontotemporal demenita (FD) according to neurologists.
Subjects who are diagnosed as dementia but are not as AD, VD, DLB OR FD.

study_pop.textblock: Subjects who are over 45 years old with or without cognitive dysfunction.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ①Subjects who are diagnosed as mild cognitive decline, Alzheimer's disease, Vascular dementia, Lewy body dementia, Frontotemporal dementia, other dementia and normal by neurologist.
- ②Subjects who can cooperate with the inspection.
- ③Subjects who agree to participate in the study and sign the consent form
Exclusion Criteria:
- ①Subjects who cannot do the inspection.
- ②Subjects who suffer from diseases that compromise the inspection.

overall_official.affiliation: Zhongshan Ophthalmic Center, Sun Yat-sen University
